Eder SánchezIndex 0: In 2002, at the Central American and Caribbean Junior Championships (U-17) held in Bridgetown, Barbados, Eder Sánchez won 1st place in the 5 km event, setting a championship record with a time of 21:24.33.
Eder SánchezIndex 1: In 2004, Eder Sánchez secured 1st place in the 10 km event at the Central American and Caribbean Junior Championships (U-20) in Coatzacoalcos, México, with a time of 43:21.99.
Eder SánchezIndex 5: At the 2007 World Championships in Osaka, Japan, Eder Sánchez finished 4th in the 20 km event, recording a time of 1:23:36.
Eder SánchezIndex 6: Eder Sánchez placed 15th in the 20 km event at the 2008 Olympic Games in Beijing, PR China, with a time of 1:21:53.
Eder SánchezIndex 7: Eder Sánchez won the bronze medal at the 2009 World Championships in Berlin, Germany, in the 20 km event, finishing with a time of 1:19:22.
Eder SánchezIndex 8: In 2010, at the Central American and Caribbean Games in Mayagüez, Puerto Rico, Eder Sánchez clinched 1st place in the 20 km event, setting a games record with a time of 1:22:32.
Eder SánchezIndex 10: Eder Sánchez finished 6th in the 20 km event at the 2011 Pan American Games in Guadalajara, Mexico, with a time of 1:25:00.
Eder SánchezIndex 9: In the 2011 World Championships in Athletics held in Daegu, South Korea, Eder Sánchez competed in the 20 km event and finished in 15th position with a time of 1:23:05.
Eder SánchezIndex 2: During the 2004 World Junior Championships in Grosseto, Italy, Eder Sánchez participated in the 10 km event and secured 4th position with a time of 41:01.64.
Eder SánchezIndex 3: Eder Sánchez took part in the 2005 World Championships in Athletics in Helsinki, Finland, competing in the 20 km event where he placed 8th with a time of 1:20:45.
Eder SánchezIndex 4: At the 2006 Central American and Caribbean Games in Cartagena, Colombia, Eder Sánchez competed in the 20 km event, finishing 2nd with a time of 1:26:30.
